instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PP5V_S4RS3: What is PP5V_S4RS3? PP5V_S4RS3 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..
definitions.PM_SLP_SUS_L:
What is PM_SLP_SUS_L? 
The "PM_SLP_SUS_L" signal in a MacBook is related to the power management of the device, specifically concerning the 'suspend to RAM' state or S3 state. It's an active-low signal that, when asserted (low voltage), indicates the system should enter or is in the S3 sleep state. .
definitions.3V3_SUS: What is 3V3_SUS? 3V3_SUS is an abbreviation for PP3V3_SUS. These are interchangeable. The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B dead
threads.message:
Hi!

I have here a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B board: fan is not spinning, but i have orange/green magsafe light.
No water damage, no drops and under scope inspection everything seems to be nice and clean.
Where you suggest start checking?

Thanks!!!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B dead
threads.message:
Posting some (exact) voltages from the board.
Like <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>/SUS and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.
Good if you post more...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B dead
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B dead
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 50390"]Posting some (exact) voltages from the board.
Like <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>/SUS and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.
Good if you post more...[/QUOTE]

Here it is:

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>      8.2v
<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL>    3.3v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>            5v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>           3.3v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL>     0v


Thanks!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B dead
threads.message: Your issue is PPBUS it should NOT be 8.2 but rather 8.6. <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> voltage? This is looking like a bad SMC to me. Post that voltage first

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B dead
threads.message:
[QUOTE="johnb8812, post: 50398"]your issue is ppbus it should not be 8.2 but rather 8.6. <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> voltage? This is looking like a bad smc to me. Post that voltage first[/quote]

<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> 3.3v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B dead
threads.message:
If you get orange light, <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> should be good.
<SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> present also means <SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> is OK.

I asked about <SIGNAL>3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> and no response.
If miss it and also <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_SUS_L</SIGNAL>, then check all (4) RTC signals from page 12.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B dead
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 50400"]If you get orange light, <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> should be good.
<SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> present also means <SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> is OK.

I asked about <SIGNAL>3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> and no response.
If miss it and also <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_SUS_L</SIGNAL>, then check all (4) RTC signals from page 12.[/QUOTE]

Sorry, i've missed that.
<SIGNAL>3V3_SUS</SIGNAL>: 3.3v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B dead
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B dead
threads.message: Is PPBUS 8.2 or 8.6? If 8.2, you have a bad SMC.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B dead
threads.message:
[QUOTE="JohnB8812, post: 50405"]Is PPBUS 8.2 or 8.6? If 8.2, you have a bad SMC.[/QUOTE]

Tried a mild reflow on SMC, now the fan spins but screen stays black, so i will change SMC.
thanks John!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B dead
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_SUS_L</SIGNAL> is 1.06v"
That is bad, should be 3V.
Are you sure?
Strange to get <SIGNAL>3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> then.

If symptom changed after reflowed SMC, reball it.
If still the same, then change it.

Please do NOT quote entire post visible few centimetres above...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B dead
threads.message:
Solved: reballed SMC, working perfectly now and passed every test.

Thanks!
